column4: does wubi actually run in windows or does it install linux on a harddrive from windows, and then you reboot into linux?
wubi only installs Ubuntu. Once you reboot, it's pure Linux. (There _are_ some changes though)
ah, ok. i was wondering if it was like colinux or something
The only differences between Wubi and a normal Ubuntu install is that you don't need to repartition -- Wubi makes Ubuntu use a big file instead of a partition.
